newsArray.title: India pip Australia at the top of Test Team Rankings ahead of WTC Final
creator: abelndooka
newsArray.description: India has been crowned the new No.1 team in MRF Tyres ICC Men‚Äôs Test Rankings, with Rohit Sharma‚Äôs side leapfrogging Australia in the annual rankings update. Australia‚Äôs reign at the top of the Men‚Äôs Test Rankings comes to an end after 15 months with India going past the Aussies ahead of next month‚Äôs ICC World [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: eBusiness Weekly India has been crowned the new No.1 team in MRF Tyres ICC Men‚Äôs Test Rankings, with Rohit Sharma‚Äôs side leapfrogging Australia in the annual rankings update. Australia‚Äôs reign at the top of the Men‚Äôs Test Rankings comes to an end after 15 months with India going past the Aussies ahead of next month‚Äôs ICC World Test Championship Final. India taking on Australia in Test cricket has quickly become one of the most exciting rivalries in recent history and the rankings reversal sets up the World Test Championship Final perfectly, with the two sides set to write yet another chapter at Ultimate Test on 7 June at The Oval. Prior to the annual rankings update, Australia was at the top with 122 points with India trailing them by three points (119). The annual rankings consider all series completed since May 2020, with series completed before May 2022 weighted at 50 percent and all subsequent series weighted at 100 percent. As a result, Australia‚Äôs home series wins over Pakistan (2-0) and New Zealand (3-0) in 2019/20 was no longer in consideration, while their 4-0 win over England in 2021/22 has its weighting halved. Consequently, Australia‚Äôs ratings dropped from 121 to 116. For India, their 2-0 defeat against New Zealand in 2019/20 was no longer in consideration for the rankings, thus giving them a two-point boost from 119 to 121. Australia rose to the summit of the Test rankings under Pat Cummins‚Äô first series as captain as they walloped England 4-0 in the home Ashes in January 2022. A month prior, India themselves were at the top of the rankings before a 2-0 loss to South Africa saw them lose top spot. England‚Äôs upheaval in form under the captaincy of Ben Stokes helps them close the gap to second spot from 13 points to just two. The weightage of their 4-0 Ashes defeat and the 1-0 series defeat away against West Indies have been reduced as well. The rest of the rankings remain unchanged.

newsArray.title: Skuad kriket lelaki Malaysia muncul juara kumpulan
creator: gp
newsArray.content: ‚Äì Hanya sehari selepas menempah slot ke final , skuad kriket lelaki negara Malaysia sekali lagi berpeluang untuk meraih emas, kali ini menerusi acara (T20) di Sukan SEA, hari ini. Dalam perlawanan yang berlangsung di AZ Group Cricket Oval itu, pasukan Malaysia mengatasi Thailand dengan lapan wiket, sekali gus menjuarai Kumpulan A dan mara ke penentuan pingat emas menentang juara Kumpulan B, minggu depan. Malaysia, yang menang undian secara lambungan syiling, memilih untuk memadang dan melakukan 114 larian dalam 12.3 over, manakala lawan mereka menghasilkan 113 larian dalam 20 over. Kapten pasukan, Ahmad Faiz Mohamad Noor gembira dengan keputusan hari ini terutama dengan ak-si hebat dipamerkan Vijay Unni Suresh, Virandeep Singh dan Syed Aziz Syed Mubarak, meskipun berdepan kesukaran bermain di permukaan padang yang tidak rata. ‚ÄúAlhamdulillah satu keputusan positif hari ini, saya sangat gembira dengan prestasi dilakar pemain seperti Vijay Unni dan Virandeep yang masing-masing berjaya peroleh dua wiket, manakala Syed Aziz pula berjaya melakukan 55 larian selain dua sepanjang permainan,‚Äù katanya. Pasukan kebangsaan Malaysia merangkul perak dalam acara T20 lelaki ketika kali terakhir kriket dipertandingkan di temasya dwitahunan itu pada edisi Kuala Lumpur 2017. ‚Äì Bernama

newsArray.title: Pakistan close to grabbing top slot in ICC's ODI rankings
creator: Web Desk
newsArray.description: Pakistan are very close to grabbing the first slot in the International Cricket Council's One Day International (ODI) rankings.
newsArray.content: Pakistan are very close to grabbing the first slot in the International Cricket Council's One Day International (ODI) rankings. Currently, Pakistan are ranked third by the ICC with 112 points, behind Australia and India, which are the first and second with 113 points each. Pakistan need to win just one game to overtake both Australia and India. Pakistan are currently playing a five-match ODI series against New Zealand at home. Four matches of the series have been played so far and Pakistan are leading the series 3-0. One match was washed away by the rain. Pakistan and New Zealand are scheduled to play the fifth and the final match of the series at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium on Sunday, May 7. Pakistan will move to the first position in the ICC rankings if they win the last ODI match of the ongoing series against New Zealand.

newsArray.title: It is Dhoni‚Äôs call, let him take that: Sehwag on repetitive retirement question
creator: The Hans India
newsArray.description: MS Dhoni has been with CSK since the 2008 seasonCSK are currently third in the IPL 2023 tableThey are set to next take on MI on Saturday
newsArray.content: It is Dhoni‚Äôs call, let him take that: Sehwag on repetitive retirement question Virender Sehwag has jumped in with support for MS Dhoni , who is constantly being asked about his retirement. The repetition of the question has irritated Sehwag, with the latter questioning the need for it. Dhoni, who has been the captain of Chennai Super Kings (CSK) since 2008, has kept everyone guessing about his Indian Premier League (IPL) future. During CSK‚Äôs previous game in the IPL 2023, commentator Danny Morrison asked Dhoni if the ongoing season would be his last in the tournament. To which, the four-time IPL winning captain reacted, saying that he never commented if IPL 2023 would be his last season or not. "You've decided it is my last," Dhoni replied with a smile to Morrison's question at the Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Stadium on Wednesday. The match between Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) and CSK had no result as it was called off due to persistent rains in Lucknow. Sehwag, who never won an IPL title, stated that even if the 2023 campaign is Dhoni's last season, what is the need to ask the question to the player. "I just don't understand; why do they even ask? Even if it's his last year, why do you have to ask the player? It's his call; let him take that! Maybe he just wanted to get that answer out of Dhoni‚Äîthat it was indeed his last season. Whether it's his last year or not, only MS Dhoni knows," Sehwag said on Cricbuzz. Earlier, former India cricketer Mohammed Kaif pointed out Dhoni's significance in the CSK camp, saying the former India captain is playing as a mentor rather than as a player. Kaif stressed that Dhoni has been teaching the youngsters all the time as he wants every player to perform well under his guidance. "Mahi is no longer playing as a player but as a mentor. He chooses the team. Let's get on the field. He does not tease the seniors much but keeps on teaching the youth all the time. He wants every player, playing under him, to perform well as it will make the team's job easier," Kaif said on Star Sports' Cricket Live. Dhoni-led CSK are currently placed third in the IPL 2023 table with 11 points from 10 matches. They will next take on Rohit Sharma‚Äôs Mumbai Indians (MI) at Chepauk Stadium on Saturday. Ahead of the crucial fixture, the CSK team were seen relaxing and having fun. In a video shared by CSK‚Äôs official Twitter handle, the men in yellow were seen playing different games, including table tennis and indoor golf. Summer Holidays Vibes with the Kings! üòé #WhistlePodu #Yellove #IPL2023 ü¶Åüíõ pic.twitter.com/yE4WrwrenB Dhoni is nursing a knee injury and which is why he has not batted much this season. He has faced just 35 balls so far after nine games and has scored 74 runs.

newsArray.title: Sports Minister meets Cricket Technical Consultative Committee members
newsArray.description: The members of the newly formed Cricket Technical Consultative Committee met the Sports Minister Roshan Ranasinghe on Thursday, it is learnt.
newsArray.content: The members of the newly formed Cricket Technical Consultative Committee met the Sports Minister Roshan Ranasinghe on Thursday, it is learnt. According to highly-placed sources in the ministry, the Minister Roshan Ranasinghe had invited all five members, Sanath Jayasuriya (Chairman of the committee), Farveez Maharoof, Charith Senanayake, Asantha de Mel and Kapila Wijegunawardene to the meeting, "The meeting is being held to understand what the newly formed committee has in mind, what their plans are to take the game forward, particularly, when the team has to play the qualifying round matches (in Zimbabwe) for the World Cup," one of the ministry sources confirmed before the meeting began. In fact, Thursday's meeting was also to brief the Minister about the meeting they had with the SLC officials and what transpired in the meeting earlier this week. Thursday's meeting is the third by the committee, which was formed in April. The committee will directly provide their suggestions to the ministry and provide their roadmap ahead. It will, however, be up to the Minister to ensure that the right suggestions are implemented by the Sri Lanka Cricket board. The members of the committee declined to comment. By: Bipin Dani

newsArray.title: Whitney Win Middle School Girls Super 8‚Ä≤s
creator: Bernews5
newsArray.description: The Whitney Institute won the Middle School Girls BSSF/BCB Super 8s Cricket Tournament at the National Sports Center North Field. They finished the Round Robin tournament with a perfect 3-0 record. Whitney started the day by defeating Warwick Academy by 36 runs. Whitney batted first and scored 86 runs in their allotted seven overs with [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: The Whitney Institute won the Middle School Girls BSSF/BCB Super 8s Cricket Tournament at the National Sports Center North Field. They finished the Round Robin tournament with a perfect 3-0 record. Whitney started the day by defeating Warwick Academy by 36 runs. Whitney batted first and scored 86 runs in their allotted seven overs with openers Daley Outerbridge and Cindi-Anna Darrell scoring 13 runs each. They then limited Warwick Academy to 50 runs in their innings with Savannah Greenslade and Amaya James scoring 5 runs apiece. Whitney next took on Sandys Secondary Middle School and chased down their target of 77 in 4.5 overs. Sandy‚Äôs batted first and scored 77 runs, Sandys was led by impressive batting by Hannah Dill with 23 and A‚ÄôMeerah Richardson Swan with 34. Whitney was up to the challenge and chased the total behind E‚ÄôRynn Paynter with 30 and Alia German-Pitcher with 24 Whitney again sent their opponents to bat in the third match with Dellwood Middle School scoring 66 runs in their seven overs. Dellwood was led by Latavia Hayward who scored 19. Paynter once again led Whitney with 31 runs Sandy‚Äôs finished runners-up after defeating Dellwood and Warwick Academy. The West Enders defeated Dellwood with the final ball of the match as they chased a target of 83 set by Dellwood. Dellwood was led by Zeni Hansley with 28 and Lashee Jones with 20. Sandys Azari James led all scorers with 32 with Hannah Dill adding 25. James also led Sandys to victory over Warwick Academy. James scored 26 and Dill 11 as they crossed Warwick Academy‚Äôs score of 37 with an over to spare. Dellwood defeated Warwick Academy in the other match of the tournament. Mirabella Lohan scored 23 as the top scorer for Warwick Academy who finished their innings with 62 runs. Latavia Hayward scored 17 with Zeni Hansley scoring 15 for Dellwood who finished with 65 runs. : ,

newsArray.content: eBusiness Weekly India has been crowned the new No.1 team in MRF Tyres ICC Men‚Äôs Test Rankings, with Rohit Sharma‚Äôs side leapfrogging Australia in the annual rankings update. Australia‚Äôs reign at the top of the Men‚Äôs Test Rankings comes to an end after 15 months with India going past the Aussies ahead of next month‚Äôs ICC World Test Championship Final. India taking on Australia in Test cricket has quickly become one of the most exciting rivalries in recent history and the rankings reversal sets up the World Test Championship Final perfectly, with the two sides set to write yet another chapter at Ultimate Test on 7 June at The Oval. Prior to the annual rankings update, Australia was at the top with 122 points with India trailing them by three points (119). The annual rankings consider all series completed since May 2020, with series completed before May 2022 weighted at 50 percent and all subsequent series weighted at 100 percent. As a result, Australia‚Äôs home series wins over Pakistan (2-0) and New Zealand (3-0) in 2019/20 was no longer in consideration, while their 4-0 win over England in 2021/22 has its weighting halved. Consequently, Australia‚Äôs ratings dropped from 121 to 116. For India, their 2-0 defeat against New Zealand in 2019/20 was no longer in consideration for the rankings, thus giving them a two-point boost from 119 to 121. Australia rose to the summit of the Test rankings under Pat Cummins‚Äô first series as captain as they walloped England 4-0 in the home Ashes in January 2022. A month prior, India themselves were at the top of the rankings before a 2-0 loss to South Africa saw them lose top spot. England‚Äôs upheaval in form under the captaincy of Ben Stokes helps them close the gap to second spot from 13 points to just two. The weightage of their 4-0 Ashes defeat and the 1-0 series defeat away against West Indies have been reduced as well. The rest of the rankings remain unchanged.

Pakistan and New Zealand are scheduled to play the fifth and the final match of the series at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium on Sunday, May 7. Pakistan will move to the first position in the ICC rankings if they win the last ODI match of the ongoing series against New Zealand.

newsArray.title: It is Dhoni‚Äôs call, let him take that: Sehwag on repetitive retirement question
creator: The Hans India
newsArray.description: MS Dhoni has been with CSK since the 2008 seasonCSK are currently third in the IPL 2023 tableThey are set to next take on MI on Saturday
newsArray.content: It is Dhoni‚Äôs call, let him take that: Sehwag on repetitive retirement question Virender Sehwag has jumped in with support for MS Dhoni , who is constantly being asked about his retirement. The repetition of the question has irritated Sehwag, with the latter questioning the need for it. Dhoni, who has been the captain of Chennai Super Kings (CSK) since 2008, has kept everyone guessing about his Indian Premier League (IPL) future. During CSK‚Äôs previous game in the IPL 2023, commentator Danny Morrison asked Dhoni if the ongoing season would be his last in the tournament. To which, the four-time IPL winning captain reacted, saying that he never commented if IPL 2023 would be his last season or not. "You've decided it is my last," Dhoni replied with a smile to Morrison's question at the Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Stadium on Wednesday. The match between Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) and CSK had no result as it was called off due to persistent rains in Lucknow. Sehwag, who never won an IPL title, stated that even if the 2023 campaign is Dhoni's last season, what is the need to ask the question to the player. "I just don't understand; why do they even ask? Even if it's his last year, why do you have to ask the player? It's his call; let him take that! Maybe he just wanted to get that answer out of Dhoni‚Äîthat it was indeed his last season. Whether it's his last year or not, only MS Dhoni knows," Sehwag said on Cricbuzz. Earlier, former India cricketer Mohammed Kaif pointed out Dhoni's significance in the CSK camp, saying the former India captain is playing as a mentor rather than as a player. Kaif stressed that Dhoni has been teaching the youngsters all the time as he wants every player to perform well under his guidance. "Mahi is no longer playing as a player but as a mentor. He chooses the team. Let's get on the field. He does not tease the seniors much but keeps on teaching the youth all the time. He wants every player, playing under him, to perform well as it will make the team's job easier," Kaif said on Star Sports' Cricket Live. Dhoni-led CSK are currently placed third in the IPL 2023 table with 11 points from 10 matches. They will next take on Rohit Sharma‚Äôs Mumbai Indians (MI) at Chepauk Stadium on Saturday. Ahead of the crucial fixture, the CSK team were seen relaxing and having fun. In a video shared by CSK‚Äôs official Twitter handle, the men in yellow were seen playing different games, including table tennis and indoor golf. Summer Holidays Vibes with the Kings! üòé #WhistlePodu #Yellove #IPL2023 ü¶Åüíõ pic.twitter.com/yE4WrwrenB Dhoni is nursing a knee injury and which is why he has not batted much this season. He has faced just 35 balls so far after nine games and has scored 74 runs.

newsArray.title: Sports Minister meets Cricket Technical Consultative Committee members
newsArray.description: The members of the newly formed Cricket Technical Consultative Committee met the Sports Minister Roshan Ranasinghe on Thursday, it is learnt.
newsArray.content: The members of the newly formed Cricket Technical Consultative Committee met the Sports Minister Roshan Ranasinghe on Thursday, it is learnt. According to highly-placed sources in the ministry, the Minister Roshan Ranasinghe had invited all five members, Sanath Jayasuriya (Chairman of the committee), Farveez Maharoof, Charith Senanayake, Asantha de Mel and Kapila Wijegunawardene to the meeting, "The meeting is being held to understand what the newly formed committee has in mind, what their plans are to take the game forward, particularly, when the team has to play the qualifying round matches (in Zimbabwe) for the World Cup," one of the ministry sources confirmed before the meeting began. In fact, Thursday's meeting was also to brief the Minister about the meeting they had with the SLC officials and what transpired in the meeting earlier this week. Thursday's meeting is the third by the committee, which was formed in April. The committee will directly provide their suggestions to the ministry and provide their roadmap ahead. It will, however, be up to the Minister to ensure that the right suggestions are implemented by the Sri Lanka Cricket board. The members of the committee declined to comment. By: Bipin Dani

newsArray.title: Whitney Win Middle School Girls Super 8‚Ä≤s
creator: Bernews5
newsArray.description: The Whitney Institute won the Middle School Girls BSSF/BCB Super 8s Cricket Tournament at the National Sports Center North Field. They finished the Round Robin tournament with a perfect 3-0 record. Whitney started the day by defeating Warwick Academy by 36 runs. Whitney batted first and scored 86 runs in their allotted seven overs with [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: The Whitney Institute won the Middle School Girls BSSF/BCB Super 8s Cricket Tournament at the National Sports Center North Field. They finished the Round Robin tournament with a perfect 3-0 record. Whitney started the day by defeating Warwick Academy by 36 runs. Whitney batted first and scored 86 runs in their allotted seven overs with openers Daley Outerbridge and Cindi-Anna Darrell scoring 13 runs each. They then limited Warwick Academy to 50 runs in their innings with Savannah Greenslade and Amaya James scoring 5 runs apiece. Whitney next took on Sandys Secondary Middle School and chased down their target of 77 in 4.5 overs. Sandy‚Äôs batted first and scored 77 runs, Sandys was led by impressive batting by Hannah Dill with 23 and A‚ÄôMeerah Richardson Swan with 34. Whitney was up to the challenge and chased the total behind E‚ÄôRynn Paynter with 30 and Alia German-Pitcher with 24 Whitney again sent their opponents to bat in the third match with Dellwood Middle School scoring 66 runs in their seven overs. Dellwood was led by Latavia Hayward who scored 19. Paynter once again led Whitney with 31 runs Sandy‚Äôs finished runners-up after defeating Dellwood and Warwick Academy. The West Enders defeated Dellwood with the final ball of the match as they chased a target of 83 set by Dellwood. Dellwood was led by Zeni Hansley with 28 and Lashee Jones with 20. Sandys Azari James led all scorers with 32 with Hannah Dill adding 25. James also led Sandys to victory over Warwick Academy. James scored 26 and Dill 11 as they crossed Warwick Academy‚Äôs score of 37 with an over to spare. Dellwood defeated Warwick Academy in the other match of the tournament. Mirabella Lohan scored 23 as the top scorer for Warwick Academy who finished their innings with 62 runs. Latavia Hayward scored 17 with Zeni Hansley scoring 15 for Dellwood who finished with 65 runs. : ,
